newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Five die in fiery tanker truck crash in Brazil.
newsitem.headline: Five die in fiery tanker truck crash in Brazil.

text.p: Five people were killed when two tanker trucks exploded after colliding on a remote highway in northern Brazil on Tuesday, police said.
"Five people died instantly and we don't know yet how many were injured," a policeman in Para state said. The crash occurred about 500 miles (800 km) south of Para's capital, Belem.
One truck was carrying gasoline and the other was carrying amonia, the policeman said, adding it was not clear what caused the accident.
He denied news reports that as many as 15 people were killed.
